title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: Building institutional capacity at Corporacin de Proteccin del Ahorro Bancario (COPAB). Specific assistance in the bank resolution area will contribute to organize COPAB into an independent, efficient agency able to support renewed growth in the banking sector. The project will equip COPAB with fast-response capability and a range of options should it be required to address bank failure at some future point. Strengthening of bank supervision capacity through a combination of training and technical assistance, the project will aim at bringing the policies and operational capacity of the Superintendency of Financial Institutions up to international standards, particularly with respect to recent developments in macro-prudential regulation, the supervision of treasury operations, and expected Basel III guidelines. The project will aim at establishing a Financial Stability Committee as an independent entity able to carry out relevant modeling and analytical work in the sector.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

description.narrative: Develop capacity to conduct financial Investigations; FIU financial analysis training; and investigation of organized crime groups. Mentor national police organized crime unit and enable this unit to self-train in financial investigative techniques. Train in asset tracing, seizure and forfeiture and related management of seized/forfeited assets in collaboration with USMS/DOJ.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Creation of a Primary Dealer Network to set forth the criteria for participants acting as debt underwriters and market makers. Banco Central del Uruguay (BCU) currently auctions debt in the domestic market on a regular basis. The bidders are the local commercial banks, and these banks are also the principal price makers in the secondary trading market. There is no formal arrangement between BCU and the banks as to responsibilities or conduct. The creation of a Primary Dealer Network would formalize the roles and responsibilities of all parties. The Network would establish metrics for evaluating performance in both the primary and secondary markets. BCUs debt, while issued domestically, is purchased primarily by the commercial banks and some of their institutional investors. There is a need to broaden the market for this debt. The establishment of a Retail Program for individual investors is intended to reach more investors and to find more stable sources of funding.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Uruguay - Banking and Financial Services

description.narrative: The intermittent advisor is working to build institutional capacity at COPAB. Specific assistance in the bank resolution area is helping to organize COPAB into an independent, efficient agency able to support renewed growth in the banking sector. The project will equip COPAB with fast-response capability and a range of options should it be required to address bank failure at some future point. At the Superintendency of Financial Institutions, the advisors are working to strengthen bank supervision capacity through a combination of training and technical assistance. The project aims to bring the policies and operational capacity of the Superintendency of Financial Institutions up to international standards, particularly with respect to recent developments in macro-prudential regulation, the supervision of treasury operations, and expected Basel III guidelines. The advisors are also working to assist the Superintendency in establishing Financial Stability Committee as an independent entity able to carry out relevant modeling and analytical work in the sector.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Uruguay

description.narrative: In an initial engagement, OTAs Banking & Financial Services Team placed a resident advisor at the Superintendency of Financial Services (SFS) from 2012-2014. During that period, the advisor assisted the SFS and the Ministry of Finance (MOF) to design and issue a variety of legal frameworks critical to expanding access, including: a Financial Inclusion law; an E-Money Issuer law; a Correspondent Agent Banks circular; a Retail Bank License circular; and a Simplified Savings Account circular. Recently, the Uruguayan National Development Agency (ANDE) asked OTA to provide assistance on an intermittent basis. OTA will assist ANDE in designing relevant incentives for increasing MSMEs financial access within a sound regulatory framework. Work will focus on strengthening the National Guarantees System, implementing secured transaction reform, establishing seed capital funds, and facilitating easier access for MSMEs to the Uruguayan capital market. This work will commence in the second quarter of 2018..

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Strenghten the skills of CND, MEF and other relevant agencies related to them in order to improve their capacity to design, contract and implement viable infrastructure projects that promote economic and social development. Provide TA in the structureing of transactions, the development of requests for proposals, draft contracts and bidding methodologies, as well as assistance in the development of Terms of Reference for the contracting of transaction advisors, assistance in the evaluation of technical studies, review of different methodologies for quantification and allocation of risk, as well as risk mitigation tools.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Uruguay IFT - Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Strengthen the skills of CND, MEF and other relevant agencies to improve their capacity to design, contract and implement viable infrastructure projects. Provide TA in structuring of transactions, the development of requests for proposals, draft contracts and bidding methodologies. Assist in the development of Terms of Reference for transaction advisors, evaluating technical studies, quantifying and allocating risk, as well as in the design of risk mitigation tools.
